alert.note: Alert for Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 7:07PM MDT until June 25 at 7:42PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River At La Junta affecting Otero County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River NEAR Avondale affecting Pueblo County. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Avondale, La Junta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Arkansas River At La Junta. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Moderate Flood. Local residential flooding is possible in La Junta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM MDT Saturday was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 05/12/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM MDT.
